channel.title: briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesPoliticsOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump confirms approval of CIA covert actions in Venezuela
item.description: President Trump said Wednesday he authorized the CIA to secretly conduct operations in Venezuela, including possible strikes against drug cartels. Why...

item.title: GOP congressman says Capitol Police is investigating swastika in his office
item.description: Rep. Dave Taylor’s office called the appearance of an American flag with a swastika on it “vile vandalism.” An image of the flag taken from a virtual ...

item.title: Supreme Court signals willingness to pare back Voting Rights Act
item.description: The Supreme Court seemed inclined Wednesday to at least chip away at — and maybe to fully scrap — a key tenet of the Voting Rights Act . The big pictu...

item.title: Federal firings could reach 10,000 during shutdown, Vought says
item.description: OMB director Russell Vought said Wednesday that more than 10,000 federal workers could end up getting fired during the shutdown. Why it matters: That'...

item.title: "A dark day": Pentagon confiscates badges of Defense reporters
item.description: Nearly every Pentagon reporter from almost every major media outlet in America turned in their press badges Thursday, after refusing to endorse the De...

item.title: Israel warns U.S. Gaza deal could stall if Hamas won't return hostage bodies
item.description: Israel on Wednesday told the Trump administration that Hamas isn't doing enough to recover the bodies of dead Israeli hostages , and the Gaza deal can...

item.title: U.S. pushes Russia to negotiate as Hegseth warns Moscow of ‘costs’
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky is pushing for Tomahawk missiles as the Trump administration tries to prod Russia into talks on ending the war.

item.title: U.S. revoked at least six visas over Kirk comments, State Department says
item.description: “The United States has no obligation to host foreigners who wish death on Americans,” it said, adding that it continues to identify visa holders who h...

item.title: Supreme Court seems open to limiting key section of Voting Rights Act
item.description: Further limits on the use of race in drawing electoral districts could have a major impact on representation in Congress and legislatures.

item.title: Judge orders Trump administration to pause shutdown layoffs
item.description: Unions have sued to block dismissals during the government shutdown.

item.title: Trump's approval holds steady despite unpopular policies, per new NYT poll
item.description: Trump’s strength with Republicans on the economy could prove to be a boon for the GOP.

item.title: New poll reveals warning signs for Trump with Latino voters
item.description: A survey from the liberal-leaning group Somos Votantes shows Latino voters are souring on the president.

item.title: Trump is selling a strong economy. Voters aren’t buying it.
item.description: Privately, aides concede voters remain uneasy about prices but argue their policies are beginning to turn things around.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
